metadata.title: CVE-2024-26833 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/amd/display: Fix memory leak in dm_sw_fini() After destroying dmub_srv,the memory associated with it is not freed, causing a memory leak:unreferenced object 0xffff896302b45800 (size 1024): comm "(udev-worker)",pid 222, jiffies 4294894636 hex dump (first 32 bytes): 00 00 00 00 00 00 0000 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 ................ 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 0000 00 00 00 00 00 ................ backtrace (crc 6265fd77):[<ffffffff993495ed>] kmalloc_trace+0x29d/0x340 [<ffffffffc0ea4a94>]dm_dmub_sw_init+0xb4/0x450 [amdgpu] [<ffffffffc0ea4e55>]dm_sw_init+0x15/0x2b0 [amdgpu] [<ffffffffc0ba8557>]amdgpu_device_init+0x1417/0x24e0 [amdgpu] [<ffffffffc0bab285>]amdgpu_driver_load_kms+0x15/0x190 [amdgpu] [<ffffffffc0ba09c7>]amdgpu_pci_probe+0x187/0x4e0 [amdgpu] [<ffffffff9968fd1e>]local_pci_probe+0x3e/0x90 [<ffffffff996918a3>] pci_device_probe+0xc3/0x230[<ffffffff99805872>] really_probe+0xe2/0x480 [<ffffffff99805c98>]__driver_probe_device+0x78/0x160 [<ffffffff99805daf>]driver_probe_device+0x1f/0x90 [<ffffffff9980601e>]__driver_attach+0xce/0x1c0 [<ffffffff99803170>] bus_for_each_dev+0x70/0xc0[<ffffffff99804822>] bus_add_driver+0x112/0x210 [<ffffffff99807245>]driver_register+0x55/0x100 [<ffffffff990012d1>] do_one_initcall+0x41/0x300Fix this by freeing dmub_srv after destroying it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26833` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
